Title.evidence: This trial evaluated the efficiency and quality of a conventional method and a methylene blue–assisted method in a randomized manner.

Trial_Design.evidence: Between August 2012 and December 2012, 60 patients were assigned to undergo treatment using the conventional method (n=29) and the methylene blue dye method (n=31).

Participants.evidence: The key eligibility criteria were as follows: (i) histologically proven adenocarcinoma of the stomach; (ii) clinical stage I-III; (iii) R0 resection planned by gastrectomy with D1+ or D2 lymphadenectomy.

Intervention.evidence: This trial evaluated the efficiency and quality of a conventional method and a methylene blue–assisted method in a randomized manner.

Objective.evidence: This trial evaluated the efficiency and quality of a conventional method and a methylene blue–assisted method in a randomized manner.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the ratio of the pathologic number of harvested LNs per time (minutes) as an efficacy measure.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between August 2012 and December 2012, 60 patients were assigned to undergo treatment using the conventional method (n=29) and the methylene blue dye method (n=31).

Number_Analysed.evidence: The number of harvested LNs (mean±SD) was 33.6±11.9 in the conventional arm and 43.4±13.9 in the methylene blue arm ( P =0.005).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The number of harvested LNs (mean±SD) was 33.6±11.9 in the conventional arm and 43.4±13.9 in the methylene blue arm ( P =0.005). The ratio of the number of the harvested LNs per time was 1.12±0.46 LNs/min in the conventional arm and 1.49±0.59 LNs/min in the methylene blue arm ( P =0.010).
